{{cpp/title|showpoint|noshowpoint}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|ios}}
{{dcl|num=1|
std::ios_base&amp; showpoint( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|
std::ios_base&amp; noshowpoint( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Enables or disables the unconditional inclusion of the decimal point character in floating-point output. Has no effect on input.

@1@ Enables the {{tt|showpoint}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.setf(std::ios_base::showpoint)}}.
@2@ Disables the {{tt|showpoint}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.unsetf(std::ios_base::showpoint)}}.

This is an I/O manipulator, it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::showpoint}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}} or with an expression such as {{c|in &gt;&gt; std::showpoint}} for any {{tt|in}} of type {{lc|std::basic_istream}}.

The character to use as decimal point character is determined by the numpunct facet of the locale imbued in the stream at the time of output, as described in {{lc|std::num_put::put}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|reference to I/O stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|str}} (reference to the stream after manipulation).

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "1.0 with showpoint: " &lt;&lt; std::showpoint &lt;&lt; 1.0 &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "1.0 with noshowpoint: " &lt;&lt; std::noshowpoint &lt;&lt; 1.0 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
1.0 with showpoint: 1.00000
1.0 with noshowpoint: 1
}}
